page.title: 02CONSERVATION IN THE AREA
page.content: The over-riding primary planning policy in the area is one of conserv- ation and enhancement of its special character, i.e. landscape, village, vegetation cover, wildlife. The area, which is rich in flora and fauna, is well covered by trees and in parts is thickly wooded, whilst the remaining open countryside is given over to farming. To live in a rural area, such as this, needs a special affection for the countryside as it is not always convenient, but those who do, would not exchange it for an urban exist- ence. The inhabitants are keen watch- dogs, always mindful of changes, and anxious to conserve their environment. The proposed development of a Pop Festival site in 1972 prompted the formation of the Nailbourne Protection Society which has defeated plans for a waste tip and the removal of woodland.
